meanings.definition: Having a head of hair or foliage that is thick and bushy.
meanings.sent1: The lion's mane was comous, making it look majestic and powerful.
meanings.sent2: Her comous hair flowed down her back in beautiful waves.
meanings.sent3: The comous tree seemed to be showing off its lush green leaves.
meanings.sent4: The comous bushes in the garden danced in the wind like a group of synchronized swimmers.
meanings.sent5: The comous fur of the teddy bear was so soft and fluffy, like a cloud.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the characteristics of a tuft of hair or foliage.
meanings.sent1: The comous caterpillar had tiny hairs that looked like little tufts.
meanings.sent2: The comous texture of the fabric reminded her of a soft, fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent3: The comous pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: The comous design of the rug added a touch of warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The comous appearance of the plant gave it a unique and charming look.
